That it has increased the temperature of the earth at different times in history. I have also noticed that it is mainly America and Europe that continue this global warming theory (oops, I meant to say climate change) and that many scientists from other countries do not subscribe to that pattern of thought. I personally don't know what the answer is. But, I will say that pollution in and of itself is not a good thing. So, I think people should mainly be focused on that in which they know.

content: quote: Originally posted by tower111: Global warming. I remember when mr Gore was preaching ice age, ice age You do? Now that is news to me. You got a quote you can make up handy? quote: Originally posted by tower111: A science fact in the news about 5 months ago. The volcano that erupted in south america has spewed more CO2 and other gas into the air than mankind has since we have been around. Mt Ranier, Mt Shasta and other live and dorment vocanos are out gassing massive amount of CO2 24 ours a day. ????And it is hard to imagine 250 years ago how much methane was released by the millions upon millions of buffalo and other animals in Africa were releasing along with the millions of acres of wild fires that nature set every year. Thats a lot of carbon and CO2 etc. of course now that we are inb a cooling period they dropped global warming and now use climate change: so either way we go we are at fault. This happens to be a myth (But it sure sounds good). While eruptions do put out a lot of CO2, it amounts to NOTHING compared to the industrial output of our cars, factories and heating systems. quote: Measurements of CO2 levels over the past 50 years do not show any significant rises after eruptions. Total emissions from volcanoes on land are estimated to average just 0.3 Gt of CO2 each year - about a hundredth of human emissions (pdf document). "http://www.newscientist.com/article/dn11638" quote: Originally posted by tower111: I emember the 1950s, we have com a long way. Hell it was hard to breath in the SF bay area. When the clean air and water laws were proposed, the reasons for them was referred to as "Junk Science." We were told by those who polluted us, that it was actually good for us; that the economy would collapse, and civilisation as we know it would end. You appear to be old enough to remember this - Do you remember all those who told us that doom awaited us if we passed these laws? Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: I saw 3 geese flying NORTH today. Of course there is no solid proof either way IMHO the debate continues, but NASA sure does think so. "http://www.guardian.co.uk/science/2009/mar/18/nasa-climate-change-james-hansen" Dems suck at pushing GW agenda... If you want, I'll send you a 2009 calendar. Spring started last week..the Geese do fly North now, right? I was wondering about that... But to fill people in, Geese normally all migrate South for the Winter - About twenty years ago, half of them ceased to migrate. They now over winter. And the numbers of Geese who over-winter has been increasing yearly. Same for quite a few other birds. When I was a kid and a young man, I never saw Robins in the Winter - Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: I will attest to exactly that Dave. Go to the Sub Base at Kings Bay, GA. There are many geese that do 'Winter Over' there! Protected there--yes! Better climate--sure--although it can get cold down here, it certainly isn't as bad as up North! I attempted to become a wild-life photographer from 2003-6, before I went back to fixing boilers. It was a real eye-opener to see (and photograph) all these birds who are just NOT supposed to be here. That first Winter was a "normal" New York Winter, meaning it felt like Siberia, since it's been so long. And on the coldest days, the Geese seemed to be arguing with each other, "Ok, whose idea was it to stay in New York for the Winter?" But stay they did... Dave

reply: =---http://www.theregister.co.uk/2009/02/25/jstor_climate_report_translation/]http://www.theregister.co.uk/2009/02/25/jstor_climate_report_translation/ People also forget that the sun also has its cycles. That it has increased the temperature of the earth at different times in history. I have also noticed that it is mainly America and Europe that continue this global warming theory (oops, I meant to say climate change) and that many scientists from other countries do not subscribe to that pattern of thought. I personally don't know what the answer is. But, I will say that pollution in and of itself is not a good thing. So, I think people should mainly be focused on that in which they know.

content: quote: Originally posted by tower111: Global warming. I remember when mr Gore was preaching ice age, ice age You do? Now that is news to me. You got a quote you can make up handy? quote: Originally posted by tower111: A science fact in the news about 5 months ago. The volcano that erupted in south america has spewed more CO2 and other gas into the air than mankind has since we have been around. Mt Ranier, Mt Shasta and other live and dorment vocanos are out gassing massive amount of CO2 24 ours a day. ????And it is hard to imagine 250 years ago how much methane was released by the millions upon millions of buffalo and other animals in Africa were releasing along with the millions of acres of wild fires that nature set every year. Thats a lot of carbon and CO2 etc. of course now that we are inb a cooling period they dropped global warming and now use climate change: so either way we go we are at fault. This happens to be a myth (But it sure sounds good). While eruptions do put out a lot of CO2, it amounts to NOTHING compared to the industrial output of our cars, factories and heating systems. quote: Measurements of CO2 levels over the past 50 years do not show any significant rises after eruptions. Total emissions from volcanoes on land are estimated to average just 0.3 Gt of CO2 each year - about a hundredth of human emissions (pdf document). "http://www.newscientist.com/article/dn11638" quote: Originally posted by tower111: I emember the 1950s, we have com a long way. Hell it was hard to breath in the SF bay area. When the clean air and water laws were proposed, the reasons for them was referred to as "Junk Science." We were told by those who polluted us, that it was actually good for us; that the economy would collapse, and civilisation as we know it would end. You appear to be old enough to remember this - Do you remember all those who told us that doom awaited us if we passed these laws? Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: I saw 3 geese flying NORTH today. Of course there is no solid proof either way IMHO the debate continues, but NASA sure does think so. "http://www.guardian.co.uk/science/2009/mar/18/nasa-climate-change-james-hansen" Dems suck at pushing GW agenda... If you want, I'll send you a 2009 calendar. Spring started last week..the Geese do fly North now, right? I was wondering about that... But to fill people in, Geese normally all migrate South for the Winter - About twenty years ago, half of them ceased to migrate. They now over winter. And the numbers of Geese who over-winter has been increasing yearly. Same for quite a few other birds. When I was a kid and a young man, I never saw Robins in the Winter - Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: I will attest to exactly that Dave. Go to the Sub Base at Kings Bay, GA. There are many geese that do 'Winter Over' there! Protected there--yes! Better climate--sure--although it can get cold down here, it certainly isn't as bad as up North! I attempted to become a wild-life photographer from 2003-6, before I went back to fixing boilers. It was a real eye-opener to see (and photograph) all these birds who are just NOT supposed to be here. That first Winter was a "normal" New York Winter, meaning it felt like Siberia, since it's been so long. And on the coldest days, the Geese seemed to be arguing with each other, "Ok, whose idea was it to stay in New York for the Winter?" But stay they did... Dave
quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: I will attest to exactly that Dave. Go to the Sub Base at Kings Bay, GA. There are many geese that do 'Winter Over' there! Protected there--yes! Better climate--sure--although it can get cold down here, it certainly isn't as bad as up North!
